page.title: 10Quenington Court
page.content: {Quenington Court}was a commandery of the Knights Hospitallers of St. John of Jerusalam.During the 12th, 13th & 14th centuries many knights took part in the crusades to free the Holy Land from the grip of the Saracens. The crusades were highly organised. Detachments of knights were regularly trained in England and then sent to the Holy Land. A commandery is one of the places where the knights would have been trained. A knight would have received religious training, instruction in care of the sick and wounded as well as training in the arts of warfare. Quenington Court was a substantial manor with its surrounding farmland. Around a hundred people would have been required to work the land, {continued on page 11
